Article Title: Facebook and Instagram outage: Services restored after disruption affecting users worldwide
Article Text:
Users turn to X to report outage

Reason of the outage not known yet

Meta-owned social media platforms - Facebook and Instagram are back up after an outage impacting thousands of users worldwide. According to outage tracking website Downdetector .com, more than 12,000 incidents of people reporting issues with Facebook and over 5,000 reports of issues with Instagram at around 1:40 p.m. ET (11:10pm IST).The issue has now been resolved. Readers must note that Downdetector's numbers are based on user-submitted reports.The actual number of affected users may vary.During the outage, Instagram users reported about encountering the message “Something went wrong with Instagram. Instagram closed because this app has a bug. Try updating the app after its developer provides a fix for the bug”. Many took to microblogging site X to report the issue they were facing.“Alright so the whole of #Meta is down so #instagramdown #threadsdown #and #facebookdown Nothing is posting. This couldn’t have happened at a more inopportune moment. Been trying to post all day. I have brand deals due people. Fix your platforms!,” said one user on X.For Facebook users, they complained about being clogged out of their account and unable to login. They reported about seeing the message “This page is not available right now. This may be because of a technical error that we are working to get fixed. Try reloading the page.”Meta has now fixed the outage as reports of the outage on Downdetector.com have declined to 1 or less. However, Meta has not revealed the exact reason behind the outage.Early this year, hundreds of thousands of Facebook and Instagram users were impacted globally for more than two hours by an outage that was caused by a technical issue. There were more than 550,000 reports of disruptions for Facebook and about 92,000 for Instagram at the peak of the outage then.
Article Summary: Facebook and Instagram are back up after an outage impacting thousands of users worldwide. According to outage tracking website Downdetector.com, more than 12,000 incidents of people reporting issues with Facebook and over 5,000 reports of issues with Instagram. The issue has now been resolved.

Article Title: HCL Tech announces salary hikes effective October 2024; here’s how much top performers will get
Article Text:
Salary hike not to impact margins

HCL Tech has announced a 7% salary hike for its employees, effective October 2024 . Top performers at the company are set to receive raises of up to 12-15%, according to Chief People Officer Ramachandran Sundararajan.The salary increase comes as HCL Tech reported an 11% year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 4,235 crore for the second quarter ended September 30, 2024.Revenue from operations grew by 8.2% to Rs 28,862 crore compared to the same period last year.Sundararajan stated that the wage hikes are expected to have a minimal impact on the company's operating margins in the December quarter. HCL Tech is actively working to offset the impact through efficiency measures.The number of employees eligible for the hike will depend on the company's review cycle and the proportion of lateral hires who become eligible after completing a year of service. As of Q2, HCL Tech's headcount stood at 218,621, a decrease of 780 employees from the previous quarter.This move follows the company's established annual compensation review process. It comes at a time when several major Indian IT companies have shifted wage hikes to the third quarter of FY25 to manage costs and sustain profitability amidst a sluggish demand environment.HCL Tech's Q2 performance exceeded market expectations, with EBIT margin coming in at 18.6%, growing 149 basis points sequentially. The company continues to focus on efficiency and growth while investing in its workforce.
Article Summary: HCL Tech has announced a 7% salary hike for its employees, effective October 2024. Top performers at the company are set to receive raises of up to 12-15%. HCL Tech reported an 11% year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 4,235 crore.

Article Text:
Tata Group statement

"It is with a profound sense of loss that we bid farewell to Mr. Ratan Naval Tata, a truly uncommon leader whose immeasurable contributions have shaped not only the Tata Group but also the very fabric of our nation," reads a press statement by Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran.

"It is with a profound sense of loss that we bid farewell to Mr. Ratan Naval Tata, a truly uncommon leader whose immeasurable contributions have shaped not only the Tata Group but also the very fabric of our nation.

For the Tata Group, Mr. Tata was more than a chairperson. To me, he was a mentor, guide and friend. He inspired by example. With an unwavering commitment to excellence, integrity, and innovation, the Tata Group under his stewardship expanded its global footprint while always remaining true to its moral compass.

Mr. Tata's dedication to philanthropy and the development of society has touched the lives of millions. From education to healthcare, his initiatives have left a deep-rooted mark that will benefit generations to come. Reinforcing all of this work was Mr. Tata's genuine humility in every individual interaction.

On behalf of the entire Tata family, I extend our deepest condolences to his loved ones. His legacy will continue to inspire us as we strive to uphold the principles he so passionately championed."

N. Chandrasekaran

Chairman, Tata Sons

09.10.2024

Tributes pour in

India's most-revered industrialist Ratan Tata is no more. Tata Group confirmed in a statement that its Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has died. Ratan Tata took his last breath at Mumbai's Breach Candy hospital . He was admitted to the hospital for age-related ailments earlier this week and was transferred to the ICU on Wednesday.Ratan Tata was 86. Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran too confirmed the death of Ratan Tata, who he called his friend, mentor and guide."It is with a profound sense of loss that we bid farewell to Mr. Ratan Naval Tata, a truly uncommon leader whose immeasurable contributions have shaped not only the Tata Group but also the very fabric of our nation," said the press statement by N Chandrasekaran.PM Narendra Modi paid homage to Ratan Tata in a series of tweets. "Shri Ratan Tata Ji was a visionary business leader, a compassionate soul and an extraordinary human being. He provided stable leadership to one of India’s oldest and most prestigious business houses. At the same time, his contribution went far beyond the boardroom. He endeared himself to several people thanks to his humility, kindness and an unwavering commitment to making our society better," wrote PM Modi."The clock has stopped ticking. The Titan passes away. #RatanTata was a beacon of integrity, ethical leadership and philanthropy, who has imprinted an indelible mark on the world of business and beyond. He will forever soar high in our memories. R.I.P," tweeted RPG Group chairman Harsh Goenka ."India has lost a giant, a visionary who redefined modern India's path. Ratan Tata wasn’t just a business leader - he embodied the spirit of India with integrity, compassion and an unwavering commitment to the greater good. Legends like him never fade away. Om Shanti 🙏," wrote Gautam Adani.
Article Summary: Ratan Tata, 86, died at Mumbai's Breach Candy hospital. He was admitted to the hospital for age-related ailments earlier this week. Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran too confirmed the death. PM Narendra Modi paid homage to Ratan Tata in a series of tweets.

Article Title: TCS cancels Q2 earnings press conference
Article Text:
Google CEO remembers his last meeting with Ratan Tata

Anand Mahindra pays tribute to Ratan Tata

Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (TCS) is set to declare its financial results today, with analysts expecting Q2 earnings growth to be in the low single digit. The IT services company, according to a PTI report, has cancelled its press conference and interviews due to the death of Ratan Tata , chairman emeritus of Tata Sons . Citing company officials, the report said that TCS will inform the exchanges about its July-September performance after the board meeting as originally scheduled.A scheduled call with analysts at 7 pm will be held as per schedule, they said.However, the press conference that was originally scheduled at 5:30pm in the evening today has been cancelled.In the previous quarter Q1 FY25, TCS posted a 9% increase in net profit, reaching Rs 12,040 crore, up from Rs 11,074 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations grew by 5%, totaling Rs 62,613 crore for the June 2024 quarter, compared to Rs 59,381 crore in the year-ago quarter.Google CEO Sundar Pichai took to X (formerly Twitter) to honor the memory of Ratan Tata, the legendary industrialist who passed away at the age of 86. "My last meeting with Ratan Tata at Google, we talked about the progress of Waymo and his vision was inspiring to hear," Pichai tweeted. He praised Tata's "extraordinary business and philanthropic legacy" and his instrumental role in mentoring and developing modern business leadership in India.Pichai emphasised Tata's deep commitment to improving India, stating, "He deeply cared about making India better." He concluded his message with condolences to Tata's loved ones.Anand Mahindra, the Chairman of Mahindra Group paid a heartfelt tribute to the late Ratan Tata, former chairman of the Tata Group. In a post shared on X, Mahindra expressed his deep sorrow and inability to accept Tata's passing. He wrote “I am unable to accept the absence of Ratan Tata. India’s economy stands on the cusp of a historic leap forward. And Ratan’s life and work have had much to do with our being in this position. Hence, his mentorship and guidance at this point in time would have been invaluable. With him gone, all we can do is to commit to emulating his example. Because he was a businessman for whom financial wealth and success was most useful when it was put to the service of the global community. Goodbye and Godspeed, Mr. T You will not be forgotten. Because Legends never die…Om Shanti”
Article Summary: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (TCS) is set to declare its financial results today, with analysts expecting Q2 earnings growth to be in the low single digit. The IT services company, according to a PTI report, has cancelled its press conference and interviews due to the death of Ratan Tata, chairman emeritus of Tata Sons.

Article Title: RBI governor Shaktikanta Das has 'AI warning' for financial institutions: "...failures or disruptions in these systems..."
Article Text:
Shaktikanta Das, Governor, RBI

Few tech providers may dominate the market

AI introduces new vulnerabilities: Governor Das

Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) Governor Shaktikanta Das has again cautioned against the potential dangers associated with artificial intelligence (AI) in the financial sector. Speaking at the 90th High-Level Conference in New Delhi on October 14, Das said that heavy reliance on AI may pose systemic risks.Das said that while AI is transforming the financial sector, these technologies also introduce potential risks to financial stability."Latest technological advancements such as artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) have opened new avenues of business and profit expansion for financial institutions. At the same time, these technologies also pose financial stability risks," he said.He noted that the increasing use of AI might allow a few technology providers to dominate the market, which could pose systemic risks."The heavy reliance on AI can lead to concentration risks, especially when a small number of tech providers dominate the market. This could amplify systemic risks, as failures or disruptions in these systems may cascade across the entire financial sector.The Governor pointed out that AI introduces vulnerabilities, including increased susceptibility tocyberattacks and data breaches ."Moreover, the growing use of AI introduces new vulnerabilities, such as increased susceptibility to cyberattacks and data breaches. Additionally, AI's opacity makes it difficult to audit or interpret the algorithms which drive decisions. This could potentially lead to unpredictable consequences in the markets," Das noted.Banks and other financial institutions are urged to place adequate risk mitigation measures against these risks.“In the ultimate analysis, banks have to ride on the advantages of AI and Bigtech and not allow the latter to ride on them,” he added.
Article Summary: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has again cautioned against the potential dangers associated with artificial intelligence (AI) in the financial sector. Das said that heavy reliance on AI may pose systemic risks. The Governor pointed out that AI introduces vulnerabilities, including increased susceptibility to cyberattacks and data breaches.

Article Title: Delhi High Court to Wikipedia: You may be world’s powerful entity but we live in a country which …
Article Text: The Delhi High Court delivered a sharp rebuke to Wikipedia on Monday, asserting India's commitment to the rule of law in response to the platform's stance in an ongoing defamation case. The court's statement came during a hearing of Wikipedia's appeal against an order to disclose user information in a suit filed by news agency Asian News International (ANI).The court took particular exception to a Wikipedia page titled "Asian News International vs.Wikimedia Foundation " about the pending case. Chief Justice Manmohan warned, "This page will have to be taken down, otherwise you will not hear. You have put learned single-judge in line of fire."The bench further cautioned Wikipedia's legal representatives, stating, "You may be world's powerful entity but we live in a country which is governed by law and we take pride in that," as reported by Live Law.At issue is Wikipedia's refusal to disclose the identities of users who allegedly made defamatory edits to ANI's Wikipedia page. ANI has sued Wikipedia for defamation over these edits.Senior Advocate Akhil Sibal, representing Wikipedia, argued for protecting user anonymity and requested to be heard on this aspect. However, the court questioned the platform's role, suggesting it might be "something more than an intermediary" by defending the users who made the edits."The system cannot be a cloak to defame someone," the division bench comprising Chief Justice Manmohan and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela remarked, warning that Wikipedia's stance could jeopardise itsintermediary protection under the Information Technology Act .The court also criticised Wikipedia for potentially interfering with sub-judice matters through its dedicated page on the case. "Who is the person in charge? Call him here. He can't be interfering with a sub-judice proceeding. He can't put the fear of God in the single judge," the bench stated.This development follows a previous warning in September when a single judge threatened to impose contempt charges and block Wikipedia in India for non-compliance with court orders.The court has scheduled the next hearing for Wednesday, directing Wikipedia to seek instructions regarding the removal of the controversial page about the ongoing case.
Article Summary: The Delhi High Court delivered a sharp rebuke to Wikipedia on Monday, asserting India's commitment to the rule of law. The court's statement came during a hearing of Wikipedia's appeal against an order to disclose user information in a suit filed by news agency Asian News International (ANI)

Article Title: Apple may have a 'new' top priority to take on Amazon and Google
Article Text:
Why Apple has struggled in smart home category and how this can change

Key elements of Apple's smart home strategy

After playing catch-up to Amazon and Google Apple is launching an aggressive new push into the smart home market, Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has said, adding that the company is developing a suite of new products and software designed to create an integrated home experience.Gurman said that "the company is setting out to conquer the smart home with an aggressive new strategy" which is "putting Apple screens and software throughout the house in a way that creates an end-to-end experience.""Over the next two years, I expect home hardware to be a top priority for Apple.The push will include developing a new homeOS operating system and smart display, as well as a higher-end robotic tabletop device," he said in the latest edition of his newsletter Power On.Gurman says that one of the reasons that Apple has struggled in this space is its focus on making premium products that work in a closed ecosystem, while an effective strategy in the smart home category is to make equipment available that can work with a wide range of other products."For Apple’s next slate of home hardware to be successful, it has to support as many accessories as possible — and the company is preparing to do just that. It helped develop a smart home protocol calledMatter that allows Amazon, Google and Apple devices to all play nicely together," Gurman writes.Apple's previous forays into the smart home have been met with limited success. Products like the original HomePod and Apple TV, while having their fans, have struggled to gain significant market share against competitors.As per Gurman, Apple may have a bunch of things to address in order to succeed in the smart home market. The first is expanding its ecosystem and embracing the Matter smart home standard. The second is to leverage its new Apple Intelligence platform to deliver advanced home automation and precise control of devices and apps.The third will be new software and devices. Apple is said to be developing a dedicated homeOS operating system, a new smart display similar to an affordable iPad and a high-end robotic tabletop device with advanced features."To jump-start these efforts, the company is building a new Home Ecosystem team and moving some engineers from the shuttered car project to work on home products," Gurman said.
Article Summary: Apple is launching an aggressive new push into the smart home market, Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has said. Gurman says Apple is developing a suite of new products and software designed to create an integrated home experience. Article Text:

The Tamil Nadu government has declared a holiday for schools and colleges in Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, and Chengalpattu districts on October 15. This decision was made during a review meeting chaired by Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday, October 14. Additionally, 169 camp offices, cooking spaces, 59 JCBs, 272 tree cutters, 176 water drainers, 130 generators, and 115 lorries are on standby as part of monsoon preparedness. Similarly, district collectors from Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu, and Kanchipuram outlined the precautionary measures taken in their respective districts.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported that a low-pressure area formed over the southeast Bay of Bengal at 0530 hrs IST on October 14, 2024. It is expected to become a well-marked low-pressure area and move northwestwards towards north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and adjoining south Andhra Pradesh coasts over the next two days. "Isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal between October 12-16, with the most intense downpours likely on October 14-15. An orange alert has been issued from October 14-16," the weather department stated.On Sunday, the weather department forecast heavy rains over several districts in the state for October 14, including Dharmapuri, Salem, Nilgiris, Erode, Namakkal, Ariyalur, Perambalur, Tiruchirapalli, Karur, Tiruppur, Coimbatore, Dindigul, Pudukkottai, Nagapattinam, Sivagangai, and Ramanathapuram. It also predicted heavy rains at isolated places over Villupuram, Cuddalore, Ariyalur, Perambalur, Mayiladuthurai, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Pudukkottai, Nagapattinam, Puducherry, and Karaikal.Chennai and its neighboring regions are also expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall as the northeast monsoon is likely to set in by October 15 or 16, according to the IMD. The withdrawal of the southwest monsoon has progressed rapidly and is anticipated to end within the next four days, making way for the much-awaited northeast monsoon.The IMD has reported a cyclonic circulation over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining equatorial Indian Ocean. This weather system is expected to evolve into a low-pressure area over the central parts of the south Bay of Bengal by Monday, October 14. It is likely to intensify into a well-marked low-pressure system and move northwestwards towards the northern Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and southern Andhra Pradesh coastlines within the subsequent 48 hours, bringing significant rainfall to the region.

Service Availability

The Internet Archive , a non-profit digital library that provides free access to digitised content and home to the popular Wayback Machine , is back after it was hit by a major data breach last week. However, the founder of the organisation has said that the platform is now back online in a “provisional, read-only manner".“Safe to resume but might need further maintenance, in which case it will be suspended again,” founder Brewster Kahle said, as per The Verge.Last week, The Internet Archive was hit by distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks, exposing personal information of 31 million users.The breach was first discovered when visitors to archive.org were shown a JavaScript alert stating: "Have you ever felt like the Internet Archive runs on sticks and is constantly on the verge of suffering a catastrophic security breach? The following message now reads on the website:The hack was confirmed by Have I Been Pwned, a website that tracks data breaches. In response to the attack, the Internet Archive took its services offline to investigate and strengthen its security. Over the past few days, the organisation has been gradually restoring services, including email accounts and crawlers for National Libraries.This incident occurred just weeks after Google began incorporating links to the Wayback Machine, the Internet Archive's digital archive of websites, in its search results. This means that users can access older versions of websites and archived pages.

Article Title: Government has announced these 'Chinese restrictions' on pocket lighters
Article Text:
What the DGFT order says

Why the Big ban

In an effort to reduce dependence on Chinese imports and promote domestic manufacturing, the Indian government has imposed a ban on the import of pocket lighter parts. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade ( DGFT ) issued a notification on October 13, restricting the import of these components with immediate effect.The ban is expected to have a significant impact on the import of lighter parts, which primarily originate from China."Import of parts of pocket lighters , gas fuelled, non-refillable or refillable lighters ( cigarette lighters )... is restricted with immediate effect," the directorate general of foreign trade (DGFT) said in a notification.Imports of cigarette lighters, under Rs 20, is already prohibited. The import ban is also there on pocket lighters, gas-fuelled, non-refillable or refillable.This move comes on the heels of previous import restrictions on cigarette lighters and the introduction of quality standards for flame-producing lighters. The government aims to curb the influx of substandard products and encourage domestic production.While China remains the dominant supplier, other countries like Spain, Turkey, and the UAE also contribute to India's lighter imports. The decision to ban lighter parts also aligns with the Indian government's broader strategy to reduce its trade deficit with China. Despite efforts to increase exports, India's trade deficit with its neighbor has been on the rise in recent years. By restricting imports of certain products, the government hopes to promote domestic self-sufficiency and reduce its reliance on foreign suppliers.In September 2022, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin had urged the Centre to ban single use plastic cigarette lighters to help the domestic matchbox industry. These plastic cigarette lighters, which are legally and illegally imported from countries like China, are available for Rs 10 and can substitute 20 matchboxes. Further, these non-refillable lighters result in immense plastic waste, damaging the environment and also impacting health, he had said.In the first four months of the current fiscal year, India imported lighter parts worth $3.8 million, down from $4.86 million in 2023-24.
Article Summary: The ban is expected to have a significant impact on the import of lighter parts, which primarily originate from China. The government aims to curb the influx of substandard products and encourage domestic production. The decision to ban lighter parts also aligns with the Indian government's broader strategy to reduce its trade deficit with China.

Article Title: What is Masked Aadhaar and why you should use it only for KYC or as identity proof in hotels, airports, banks and other places
Article Text:
What is Masked Aadhaar and why citizens should use it

Key features of Masked Aadhaar:

Increased privacy: Protects Aadhaar number from unauthorised access.

Reduced risk of fraud: Makes it more difficult for criminals to misuse Aadhaar information.

Equally valid: Just as acceptable as other Aadhaar formats (Aadhaar letter, PVC card, eAadhaar, mAadhaar).

Easy to obtain: Can be downloaded online from the UIDAI website.

How to download Masked Aadhaar

Visit the official UIDAI website at https://uidai.gov.in/.

Click on “Download Aadhaar” under “My Aadhaar” section,

In the new page, enter 12-digit Aadhaar number or 16-digit Virtual ID (VID), along with other required details.

In the “Select your preference” section, choose the “Masked Aadhaar” option.

Select the option to receive an One-Time Password (OTP) on your registered mobile number.

Enter the OTP to complete the verification process.

Masked Aadhaar will then be available for download in a password-protected PDF format.

Aadhaar-based fraud , where criminals use stolen Aadhaar numbers for financial gain or unauthorised access to services, is a growing concern, reports have suggested. In order to curb the misuse of Aadhaar numbers, the Unique Identification Authority of India ( UIDAI ) introduced masked Aadhaar . Here's all you need to know about it.Masked Aadhaar has been introduced by the UIDAI to enhance your privacy and reduce the risk of Aadhaar misuse .It hides the first eight digits (of the total 12) of Aadhaar number, replacing them with 'X's. This prevents others from seeing your full Aadhaar number while still allowing citizens to use it for identification purposes.The need for using Masked Aadhaar emerges as criminals are using increasingly sophisticated methods to bypass traditional security measures like OTPs and bank details to scam citizens by exploiting the Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AePS). Fraudsters are using techniques like silicon fingerprints and unauthorised devices to duplicate Aadhaar-linked biometrics, allowing them to steal money directly from victims' bank accounts.In order to download Masked Aadhar, you can follow these steps:

Article Title: Scammers are taking over Gmail accounts, here's what not to do to protect your account
Article Text:
The Rise of AI-powered phishing

Here's what not to do to protect yourself:

How to stay safe:

Gmail users beware! A kind of phishing scam is targeting inboxes, and this time, they might be smarter than ever. According to a recent report by The Forbes, scammers are utilising AI-powered techniques to craft highly personalised and convincing emails, making them more difficult to detect.These scams typically operate by mimicking legitimate sources like banks, social media platforms, or even Google itself.The emails might contain details specific to your online activity or personal information gleaned from data breaches , creating a false sense of trust.Scammers then urge you to click on a suspicious link or divulge your login credentials. Once you do, they gain access to your account and wreak havoc, potentially stealing sensitive data or hijacking other accounts linked to your Gmail.The use of AI in these scams makes them particularly dangerous. AI algorithms can analyse large amounts of data and identify patterns in email communication. This allows scammers to craft emails with personalised language and details that resonate with the recipient, increasing the likelihood of falling victim to the scam.* Clicking unfamiliar links: Never click on links embedded in emails from unknown senders. Verify the sender's email address and hover over the link to see the actual website it directs you to before clicking.* Sharing login information: Legitimate companies will never request login details through email. If an email claims to be from Google or another platform and asks for your password, it's a scam!* Rushing to respond: Scammers often use urgency to manipulate you. Don't panic! Take your time to verify the sender and information in the email before taking any action.* Enable two-factor authentication (2FA): Adding an extra layer of security, 2FA requires a code from your phone or another device to log in, even if someone has your password.* Beware of spoofed emails: Scammers can create email addresses that closely resemble legitimate companies. Look out for misspellings or unusual domains in the sender's email address.* Report phishing attempts: If you receive a suspicious email, report it to Google! This helps them track and block similar attempts in the future.
Article Summary: AI algorithms analyse large amounts of data and identify patterns in email communication. This allows scammers to craft emails with personalised language and details that resonate with the recipient, increasing the likelihood of falling victim. Never click on links embedded in emails from unknown senders. Enable two-factor authentication (2FA)

Article Title: Government to Ola: Must offer refund choices and ride bills
Article Text:
Let customers choose preferred method of refund: CCPA

Not issuing bill amount to 'unfair trade practice’

Bhavish Aggarwal-led cab aggregator Ola has been directed by the Indian government to implement a mechanism, allowing customers to choose their preferred method of refund. The Central Consumer Protection Authority ( CCPA ) under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs Food and Public Distribution has asked the ride hailing platform to offer a bill, receipt, or invoice for every auto ride booked through its platform.According to the National Consumer Helpline (NCH) data, 2,061 complaints have been registered against Ola from January 1, 2024, till October 9. Top complaints against Ola included charging higher fares than those displayed at the time of booking, failure to refund amounts owed to customers, drivers demanding extra cash, and drivers either failing to reach the correct location or dropping passengers at the wrong destination.The consumer watchdog has directed Ola to offer consumers the option to choose between refunds being credited directly to their bank accounts or provided as coupons during the grievance redressal process. The regulator observed that at present when a customer raises any grievance on the Ola app, Ola only provided a coupon code which could be used for the next ride without providing a clear choice to the consumer to opt between a bank account refund or a coupon.CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare said that "This violates consumer rights and the no-question-asked refund policy cannot mean that the company incentivises people to simply use this facility for taking another ride,".In its directive, the regulator says that if a consumer attempts to access an invoice for Auto rides booked on Ola, the app shows the message “Customer invoice for Auto rides will not be provided due to changes in Ola's auto service T&Cs”.CCPA observed that not issuing a bill or invoice or receipt for the goods sold or services offered constitutes an "unfair trade practice" under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019. It has directed the cab aggregator to offer bill to its customers.
Article Summary: Not issuing bill amount to 'unfair trade practice' says consumer watchdog. 2,061 complaints have been registered against Ola from January 1, 2024, till October 9. Top complaints against OLA included charging higher fares than those displayed at the time of booking.
